titleStmt.title: Description of Special Collections, Lehigh Codex 9: Anon. Writings on astronomy

To the extent possible under law, Lehigh University Libraries, Special Collections has waived all copyright and related or neighboring rights to this metadata about Special Collections Lehigh Codex 9: Anon. notesStmt.note: Title on binding lists c.1391 as date of origin
Quire 1 has been mended and fol. 1, which was originally conjoined with fol. 12, is now single

msContents.summary: This manuscript is a compilation of several anonymous writings on astronomy and astrology. It contains a number of tables, diagrams, and shorthand annotations. Often the compiler has made notes on a text rather than transcribe it, or has abbreviated what transcriptions he has made.

msItem.title: Easter Calendar, 1391-1585
msItem.incipit: Chi volese sapere quello che core la pascha

msItem.title: Regula secondo la chiesia romana (breaks after four-and-one-half lines, continued on fol. 48v)
An account of the seven planets, perhaps drawn from Johannes de Sacro Bosco, Tractatus de Sphera, III, or a commentary upon it.
Misura della Circonfirenzio della Terra..., drawn from Johannes de Sacro Bosco, Tractatus de Sphera, I
Two diagrams with explanations of the relationship the four Aristotelian elements, earth, air, fire and water bear to the earth, perhaps from a commentary on Johannes de Sacro Bosco
Della Conpresione del Aria e del Tempo, with subheadings
Regula secondo la chiesia romana (continued from fol. 5v)

supportDesc.foliation: Contemporary ink foliation, upper right recto; modern pencil foliation, lower right recto (our numbering follows the modern foliation)

collation.p: Modern rebinding has rendered the original collation unclear

binding.p: Modern parchment over board; Title on spine: Treatise on Astronomy in Italian, c. 1391

history.provenance: Acquired by Lehigh in 1963, from the gift to the library of Mr. Watson Over
